job_title: Senior Product Manager, Salesforce Internal Developer Experience
job_description:
• Prioritize Investments: Balance developer needs, business goals, and technical constraints to deliver maximum impact.
• Influence at Scale: Build consensus across senior engineering and security leaders, resolving conflicting tooling preferences to drive standardization.
• Champion the Product: Act as the face of developer experience internally via advisory boards, demos, and roadmap updates.
• 10+ years in Technical Product Management (or equivalent) with direct experience in developer platforms, internal tools, or DevOps products.
• 2+ years working with public cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP) and cloud-based application architectures.
• Enterprise software experience, including understanding of scale, security, and non-functional requirements.
• Exceptional communication skills, able to distill complex technical concepts for both executives and engineers.
• Data-driven decision-making skills, with experience using analytics to guide product choices.

job_title: VP of Product Management, Salesforce Internal Developer Experience
job_description:
• 15+ years of progressive product management experience, including 5+ years leading senior product leaders at scale.
• Experience driving large-scale transformations that significantly improved developer productivity, velocity, and satisfaction.
• Exceptional communication skills, equally comfortable presenting strategy to senior executive leaders and discussing technical tradeoffs with engineers.

• Build, mentor, and inspire a world-class team of product managers and developer advocates.

job_title: Director of Product Management, Salesforce AI Internal Developer Experience
job_description:
• Ensure alignment with engineering priorities, security/compliance requirements, and evolving developer needs.
• Drive Requirements from Real Developer Workflows – Translate developer pain points, insights from pilot programs, AI tool usage analytics, and engineering productivity metrics into actionable product requirements.
• Adapt to a Rapidly Evolving AI Landscape – Navigate technical and strategic uncertainty by making fast, data-driven decisions, pivoting when needed, and continuously refining the AI productivity strategy to reflect emerging models, enterprise policies, and developer needs.
• 10+ years of product management experience or related technical role5+ years of experience with SaaS/B2BDemonstrable, technical expertise with advanced AI, including LLMs, and familiarity with RAG.
• Exceptional communication skills, able to distill complex technical concepts for both executives and engineers.
• Data-driven decision-making skills, with experience using analytics to guide product choices.
